statements: SELECT * FROM ParentalSurvey WHERE survey_id = 1;
SELECT parent_name, parent_email, response_date FROM ParentalSurvey WHERE survey_id = 5;
SELECT survey_response FROM ParentalSurvey WHERE parent_name = 'Alice';
SELECT * FROM ParentalSurvey WHERE response_date >= '2022-01-01';
SELECT parent_name, parent_email FROM ParentalSurvey ORDER BY parent_name DESC;
SELECT survey_id, parent_name, parent_email, survey_response, response_date FROM ParentalSurvey WHERE survey_id = 1;
SELECT parent_name, survey_response, response_date, parent_email, survey_id FROM ParentalSurvey WHERE parent_name LIKE 'A%';
SELECT * FROM ParentalSurvey WHERE response_date BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-12-31';
SELECT parent_email, parent_name FROM ParentalSurvey ORDER BY parent_name ASC, parent_email DESC;
SELECT survey_id, survey_response, parent_name FROM ParentalSurvey WHERE survey_response LIKE '%positive%' OR survey_response LIKE '%hopeful%';
SELECT * FROM ParentalSurveyResponses;
SELECT survey_id, response FROM ParentalSurveyResponses WHERE parent_id = 123;
SELECT parent_id, COUNT(*) FROM ParentalSurveyResponses GROUP BY parent_id;
SELECT * FROM ParentalInvolvement WHERE school_id = 456 ORDER BY timestamp DESC;
SELECT parent_id, MAX(involvement_level) FROM ParentalInvolvement GROUP BY parent_id;
SELECT * FROM ParentalSurveyResponses WHERE survey_id = 1;
SELECT survey_id, response FROM ParentalSurveyResponses WHERE timestamp < '2022-05-01';
SELECT * FROM ParentalInvolvement WHERE school_id = 123 ORDER BY timestamp DESC;
SELECT parent_id, COUNT(*) AS num_responses FROM ParentalSurveyResponses GROUP BY parent_id HAVING num_responses > 2;
SELECT school_id, AVG(involvement_level) AS avg_involvement FROM ParentalInvolvement GROUP BY school_id ORDER BY avg_involvement DESC;
SELECT * FROM parent_survey_responses;
SELECT question, response FROM parent_survey_responses WHERE parent_id = 2;
SELECT id, parent_name, email FROM parent_information ORDER BY parent_name DESC;
SELECT analysis_category, analysis_result FROM school_analysis WHERE school_id = 5;
SELECT parent_id, COUNT(*) as response_count FROM parent_survey_responses GROUP BY parent_id;
SELECT * FROM parent_survey_responses;
SELECT parent_id, question, response FROM parent_survey_responses WHERE parent_id = 5;
SELECT parent_id, COUNT(*) AS total_responses FROM parent_survey_responses GROUP BY parent_id;
SELECT parent_name, email, analysis_category FROM parent_information JOIN school_analysis ON parent_id = school_id;
SELECT parent_id, question, response FROM parent_survey_responses ORDER BY parent_id DESC;
SELECT * FROM ParentalSurveyResponses;
SELECT survey_id, response, parent_id FROM ParentalSurveyResponses ORDER BY parent_id DESC;
SELECT * FROM ParentalEngagement WHERE event_name = 'Parent-Teacher Conference';
SELECT parent_id, feedback_text, rating FROM ParentalFeedback WHERE rating > 3;
SELECT feedback_id, parent_id, support_type FROM ParentalSupport ORDER BY support_date ASC;
SELECT survey_id, parent_id, question, response FROM ParentalSurveyResponses;
SELECT event_name, date, parent_id FROM ParentalEngagement WHERE parent_id = 1 ORDER BY date DESC;
SELECT COUNT(*) AS num_responses, support_type FROM ParentalSupport GROUP BY support_type HAVING num_responses > 5;
SELECT parent_id, feedback_text, rating FROM ParentalFeedback ORDER BY rating DESC, parent_id ASC;
SELECT * FROM ParentalSurveyResponses JOIN ParentalFeedback ON ParentalSurveyResponses.parent_id = ParentalFeedback.parent_id;
SELECT * FROM ParentalSurveys;
SELECT survey_id, parent_id, satisfaction_level FROM ParentalSurveys WHERE satisfaction_level > 3;
SELECT survey_date, feedback_text FROM ParentalSurveys ORDER BY survey_date DESC;
SELECT student_name, grade_level FROM Students WHERE grade_level >= 10;
SELECT teacher_name, subject_taught FROM Teachers WHERE subject_taught = 'Math';
SELECT * FROM ParentalSurveys;
SELECT survey_id, parent_id, survey_date FROM ParentalSurveys ORDER BY survey_date DESC;
SELECT DISTINCT satisfaction_level FROM ParentalSurveys WHERE satisfaction_level > 3;
SELECT parent_id, COUNT(survey_id) FROM ParentalSurveys GROUP BY parent_id HAVING COUNT(survey_id) >= 2;
SELECT feedback_text FROM ParentalSurveys WHERE feedback_text LIKE '%improvement%' ORDER BY parent_id ASC;
